column7: Design studio investigations of issues that impact urban habitats, buildings and people. Architecture and urban design, preservation, and adaptation of new and existing buildings, cities, districts, public realms and urban environments. Designing and preserving buildings and communities in a sustainable manner. Field trips may be required. 6 graduate hours. No professional credit. May be repeated in separate terms to a maximum of 12 credit hours. Prerequisite: Concurrent enrollment in ARCH 536 or consent of instructor.
